text:
If you've yet to see Avengers: Infinity in theaters, turn away now!

Since Whedon bowed out of the MCU, Joe and Anthony Russo have taken over as Marvel Studios' chief directors. But he can do it, if he acquires all six of the so-called Infinity Stones, gems of awesome power created at the moment of the Big Bang. Corvus Glaive (Michael James Shaw) and Ebony Maw (Tom Vaughan-Lawlor)-Thanos is nearly unstoppable.

But before Thanos' genocide at Avengers Infinity War's conclusion, the mad Titan killed off a few other characters.

While Marvel Studios has assembled the vast majority of its Cinematic Universe heroes for Avengers: Infinity War, their small screen counterparts weren't so lucky with the likes of The Defenders and the Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D. sitting out the big battle against Thanos.

Avengers: Infinity War ably juggles a dizzying array of MCU heroes in the fight against their gravest threat yet, and the result is a thrilling, emotionally resonant blockbuster that (mostly) realizes its gargantuan ambitions. Infinity War is estimated to earn between $225 and $245 million domestically in its first weekend, though Variety notes there's a possibility it would cross $250 million.

Chris Evans and Chadwick Boseman are heavily involved as Captain America and Black Panther, but they are "fearless leader" archetypes rather than real people with discernable emotional arcs. Gamora's plan is to keep The Orb (and Power Stone) away from Thanos, which results in her joining the Guardians of the Galaxy. So with that information in mind, that means that it's possible that Avengers: Infinity War will hit Netflix on December 1, 2018. In the first quarter of the sprawling saga we see NY being devastated by the super-villain Thanos (played with unnerving splendor by Josh Brolin). It was definitely a lot to take in, and I am going to see it a second time this weekend.

If you're going to end on a high note why not bring out the big guns? Here's a good rule of thumb: if a character died when Thanos wiped out half of the universe, then they will all be back. That's also big enough to claim the title of biggest Thursday gross for any superhero movie ever, ahead of previous champion The Dark Knight which scored $30.6 million during Thursday previews. In terms of sheer mind-blowing spectacle, Infinity War makes the entire Transformers franchise look like My Dinner with Andre.
title: Avengers: Infinity War Reviews Highlight Thanos and "Real Sacrifices"
